body_html:
Thanks @netfs and @karmel . It seems that it works if TensorFlow Serving will convert the base64 string to byte array if it meets the special key "b64". But the logic is not part of TensorFlow Graph and since we have another RESTful service like TensorFlow Serving, we need to make the convention like this.
I can close the issue and pull-request if we don't make it in TensorFlow Graph. Still not sure if it is an good idea. Or we can reserve the optional parameter to export the different model signature.

body:
Thanks @netfs and @karmel . It seems that it works if TensorFlow Serving will convert the base64 string to byte array if it meets the special key "b64". But the logic is not part of TensorFlow Graph and since we have another RESTful service like TensorFlow Serving, we need to make the convention like this.
I can close the issue and pull-request if we don't make it in TensorFlow Graph. Still not sure if it is an good idea. Or we can reserve the optional parameter to export the different model signature.
